section: 8.1 TERM. The term of this Agreement shall continue for one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be renewed for any number of successive one (1) year terms by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the conclusion of the term of this Agreement. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. In the event that either party does not give such notice, the term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for another one (1) year.
explanation: This section contains contradictory statements regarding the renewal of the agreement. It states that the agreement may be renewed by mutual written agreement with 30 days notice. However, it also states that if such notice is not given, the agreement will be automatically renewed. These two statements contradict each other.

section: In addition, 2TheMart shall indemnify i-Escrow against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which i-Escrow may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from 2TheMart Content. In addition, i-Escrow shall indemnify 2TheMart against any and all claims, losses, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, which 2TheMart may incur as a result of claims in any form by third parties arising from i-Escrow Source: 2THEMART COM INC, 10-12G, 8/26/1999 Content and or the Services provided to Customers.
explanation: This section is structurally flawed in text and hard to understand. In addition, the section seems to cut off without finishing the proper sentence.

section: 12.1 GOVERNING LAW. This Agreement will be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California without giving effect to conflict of laws principles. Both parties submit to personal jurisdiction in California and further agree that any cause of action arising under this Agreement shall be brought in a court in Orange County, California.
explanation: This section specifies that any cause of action arising under the agreement shall be brought in a court in Orange County, California. However, it does not specify which court in Orange County has jurisdiction, potentially leading to disputes regarding the proper venue for litigation.
